result.execSummary:
The defendant Sonya Nicole Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
State moves to amend Ct #1 to straight disorderly conduct, striking domestic enhancer.  Court approves.  DEF pleads No Contest to amended Ct #1.  Found Guilty.
Court imposes sentence of $443.00 costs.    Pay obligation within 60 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sonya Nicole Taylor in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Advised of rights/penalties, DEF waives right to counsel.  
Parties reached agreement.  State moves to amend Ct #1 to straight disorderly conduct, striking domestic enhancer.  Court approves.  DEF pleads No Contest to amended Ct #1.  Found Guilty.
Court imposes sentence of $443.00 costs.    Pay obligation within 60 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

Defendant Sonya Nicole Taylor in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEF has previously waived her right to an Atty.  Parties need more time to meet.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sonya Nicole Taylor in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DEF advised of rights, waives right to an Atty.  DEF to contact DA for possible resolution.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sonya Nicole Taylor in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.  DEF filed for Court appointed attorney, Court ruled on affidavit and Court Denied.    DEF still wishes to contact counsel privately.    DEF enters NG Plea, court accepts.    Bond Continues  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Petition for Appointment of An Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency and Order - DENIED
Defendant Sonya Taylor in court.  Aaron Marcoux appeared for State.    Waiting for reports.  Bond Continues.
